title: The 8 teams that most need to make a deal by trade deadline day
content: From the Yankees to the Dodgers, the sport's biggest giants are among the clubs that need to take action ahead of the July 31 deadline.

title: Will Yankees trade Spencer Jones? Why slugging prospect's rise is a deadline dilemma
content: The biggest drama of this year's deadline for the Yankees is playing out 350 miles northwest of the Bronx.

title: Jets' Fields back, but not playing, after toe injury
content: Jets quarterback Justin Fields was back at practice Friday but did not participate in any drills a day after being carted off with a dislocated toe.

title: Browns LB Hicks retiring after 10-year NFL career
content: Browns starting linebacker Jordan Hicks is retiring after 10 seasons in the NFL, he announced on Instagram on Friday morning.

title: Trump issues executive order for college sports
content: President Donald Trump has directed members of his Cabinet to develop a plan in the next 30 days aimed at preserving college sports opportunities and preventing college athletes from becoming professionals.

title: Raiders releasing Wilkins; NFLPA files grievance
content: The Raiders have informed defensive tackle Christian Wilkins that he has been released. The NFLPA has filed a grievance on his behalf after the $35.2M of guaranteed money left on his contract was voided last month.

title: No sanction for Messi, Alba All-Star Game snub
content: Inter Miami boss Javier Mascherano confirmed that Lionel Messi and Jordi Alba did not face sanctions for missing the MLS All-Star Game on Wednesday night.

title: Clark rookie card nearly doubles auction record
content: A 1-of-1 numbered, autographed Caitlin Clark rookie card went straight to auction and sold for a record $660,000.

title: Kansas' Self hospitalized, has 2 stents inserted
content: Kansas coach Bill Self was hospitalized Thursday after experiencing "some concerning symptoms" and had two stents inserted. The school said he was expected to make a full recovery.

title: Iamaleava: Left Tennessee to come back home
content: UCLA quarterback Nico Iamaleava said Thursday that his main motivation for transferring this spring was proximity to family, not the money in his NIL deal.

title: ðŸ˜‚ How Happy Gilmore's sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, big cameos and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

content: Let's pick the 25 best teams since 2000. How many Liverpool, Barcelona, Real Madrid and Bayern Munich squads make the list?

content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: Who are the best NFL draft prospects for next year? Debating the No. 1 player at 11 positions
content: Who is the top quarterback, edge rusher and corner in the 2026 NFL draft class? We debated every position's early lead.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: MLB Power Rankings: A red-hot NL team surges up to debut at No. 1
content: Our first list of the second half sees a massive shake-up in the top five, with three clubs at their highest rankings of the seasons -- including a new squad at the top.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

content: From giant red blobs and 1,700-pound steer to coonskin caps and bears riding Harleys, these are the sport's top merrymakers.

content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea join Liverpool in Isak pursuit
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak is open to leaving this summer, with Liverpool and Chelsea keen.

title: Exiled by Amorim, what does the future hold for the talented Garnacho?
content: Left at home for the club's U.S. preseason tour, Alejandro Garnacho's time in Manchester is surely coming to an end. But Ruben Amorim might regret casting him aside.

content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

content: Xander Zayas fights for his first world title, and Bruce Carrington for an interim belt. Here's a look at both fights through the numbers.

content: Brett Okamoto plays matchmaker and provides five matchups he wants the UFC to make happen by the end of 2025.

title: England's savior Agyemang embracing super-sub role, but what's next for her?
content: Michelle Agyemang's breakout Euro 2025 has helped England reach the final, but what lessons can she learn from teammates and Spain's young talent?

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: PLL Week 9 preview: Key stats, players for Archers' Homecoming
content: The PLL heads back to Salt Lake City on Friday and Saturday. Here's the full schedule, key stats, injury notes and more.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: Chinese Manjha Kills Again, 22-Year-Old Latest Victim Of Killer Kite String
content: Banned kite strings, widely known as Chinese Manjha, have claimed one more life in Delhi. Twenty-two-year-old businessman Yash Goswami was on his scooter on the Rani Jhansi flyover in north Delhi when a kite string slashed his neck

title: "For India, It Is Always Friendship First": PM Modi In Maldives
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that India has always been a close friend of the Maldives, and for India, it has always been "friendship first."

title: India, Maldives Sign Several Pacts During PM Modi's Visit, Agree On Trade Deal Terms
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday held wide ranging talks with Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu at the President's Office in Male as both leaders reviewed the entire spectrum of India-Maldives relations and reaffirmed their commitment to furthe

title: Blog: Blog | Saiyaara, And The Taming Of The Tortured-Male-Rockstar
content: Mohit Suri's film flips the script, in that it allows the girl to bypass conventions and extract an Aditya Chopra hero, prone to seeing the divine in the person he loves, from Sandeep Reddy Vanga's universe of God-complexed lovers.

title: Thailand Declares Martial Law In Areas Bordering Cambodia After Deadly Clashes
content: Thailand declared martial law in eight of its districts bordering Cambodia on Friday, as the countries traded strikes in a second deadly day of clashes.

title: While Shubhanshu Shukla Was Away, Another Astronaut Simulated Space On Earth
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has announced that in a pioneering step for India's space programme, it enabled a 10-day Space Analogue Mission named ANUGAMI at the Institute for Aerospace Medicine (IAM) in Bengaluru under the ICMR.

title: UK, Australia To Sign 50-Year Treaty To Build Nuclear Submarines
content: Britain and Australia announced they will sign a cooperation treaty to build Australian nuclear-powered submarines and welcomed a review by President Donald Trump's administration of the United States' role in the trilateral defense deal.

title: Why Israel Has Made It Mandatory For Military To Study Islam And Learn Arabic
content: The Israeli Defence Forces have made it mandatory for all soldiers and officers in the intelligence wing to train in Arabic language and Islamic Studies.

title: Delhi Boy Sexually Abused By 13, Stabbed 24 Times For Being Rival Gang's Informer
content: In a grisly revenge story, thirteen people, many of whom were minors themselves, banded together to sexually assault and stab a 14-year-old boy to death for allegedly informing a rival gang member.

title: Finland Breaks 50-Year Record With 14 Straight Days Over 30 Degrees Celsius
content: Finland has broken an over 50-year-old weather record as the country is witnessing the longest period of temperatures above 30 degrees Celsius, the Finnish Meteorological Institute said.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trade Deals vs WTO: Is Trump Hastening The World Trade Organization's Demise?
content: The current Trump tariffs may not be mimicking the pre-WWII period, but they are certainly reminiscent of that.

title: Phase 1 Of Bihar Poll Roll Revision Complete, 65.2 Lakh Voters Risk Being Removed
content: The first phase of the Bihar Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise has been completed and the names of 65.2 lakh voters are likely to be excluded.

title: Maldives Defence Force Presents PM Modi With 'Haiykolhu' As Gesture Of Hospitality
content: The Maldives National Defence Force on Friday said they presented Prime Minister Narendra Modi with the traditional 'Haiykolhu', a cherished Maldivian gesture of hospitality and honor.

title: PM Narendra Modi Maldives Visit LIVE: Maldives Holds Important Place In India's Neighbourhood First Policy: PM
content: PM Narendra Modi UK and Maldives Visit LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed in Male on Friday for a two-day Maldives visit.

title: Agniveer Killed, 2 Soldiers Injured In Landmine Blast Near LoC In J&K's Poonch
content: An armyman was killed and two others injured in a landmine blast along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district on Friday, officials said.

title: Special Prayers Held For Victims As Bangladesh Jet Crash Toll Rises To 32
content: Special prayers were held across Bangladesh on Friday, as the death count from a fighter jet crash into a school building in Dhaka rose to 32.

title: Meta To Ban Political Advertisements In EU From October, Cites Legal Issues
content: Meta Platforms will end political, electoral, social issue advertising on its platform in the European Union in early October because of the legal uncertainties due to EU rules targeting political advertising, the US social media company said.

title: As Cambodian Artillery Screamed Across Sky, Thai Woman Rushes To Save Cats
content: When the first salvo of Cambodian artillery screamed across her village, Thai seamstress Pornpan Sooksai's thoughts turned to her five beloved cats: Peng, Kung Fu, Cherry, Taro, and Batman.

title: Musk Issues Apology After Starlink Satellite Faces Hours-Long Global Outage
content: SpaceX chief Elon Musk's Starlink satellite internet service experienced an hours-long global network outage Thursday, which executives attributed to a key software issue.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Beyond Hesitations: Why The India-UK Trade Deal Is An Inflexion Point
content: For long, Indo-UK relations have been shadowed by the echoes of a colonial past. While that history must never be forgotten, it is crucial to acknowledge the evolving dynamics of a modern, democratic India and a globally engaged Britain.

title: 2K details reveal roadmap for NBA 2K26
content: Here's the schedule for all upcoming reveals and announcements for the upcoming basketball simulation.

title: PM Modi-Muizzu talks: From 'India Out' to all in for FTA - how tides turned in the Indian Ocean
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Muizzu met to improve India-Maldives relations after a period of strain caused by the "India Out" campaign and diplomatic disputes. Discussions covered trade, defence, and infrastructure, with India handing over vehicles to the Maldives.

title: Monsoon mayhem: Only thunder, no talk - a recap of Week 1 of Parliament
content: Parliament's Monsoon Session began turbulently, marked by adjournments and political clashes. New members were sworn in amidst uproar over national security and electoral roll revisions. A rare bipartisan impeachment motion against a judge and a resignation added to the drama. Despite disruptions, consensus emerged for a special debate on Operation Sindoor, scheduled to begin next week.

title: 'Could develop into war ...': Thailand issues warning; martial law in 8 areas bordering Cambodia
content: Escalating violence along the Thailand-Cambodia border has resulted in casualties and mass displacement, prompting international concern. The conflict, rooted in colonial-era border disputes, intensified with deadly attacks and military mobilization. Diplomatic efforts are underway as global powers urge de-escalation and protection of civilians amidst rising tensions and accusations of war crimes.

title: Bihar SIR: 22L dead, 7L duplicate voters - what EC has found after '99.8% coverage'
content: Bihar's Election Commission reports 99.8% voter coverage under the special intensive revision, digitizing over 7.23 crore forms for publication by August 1, 2025. The cleanup identified 22 lakh deceased voters and other discrepancies, shared with political parties for review. Despite opposition criticism, the CEC defends the process, inviting public input for corrections.

title: Bill Gates' daughter asks if heâ€™d be willing to work a shift in customer service
content: Bill Gates, the Microsoft co-founder, recently took on a customer service role at Phia, his daughter Phoebe's AI-powered fashion startup. Phoebe and her co-founder Sophia Kianni developed Phia, a platform that helps users compare prices across numerous online retailers. Gates emphasized the importance of directly engaging with users to understand a product's functionality and potential issues.

title: Visit turns awkward: Fed Chair publicly fact-checks Trump - Watch
content: During a tour of the Federal Reserve, President Trump publicly clashed with Chair Jerome Powell over renovation costs, alleging a $3.1 billion overrun. Powell refuted the claim, clarifying that Trump was including a separate, completed building in the calculation. Despite Powell's explanation, Trump maintained his stance and criticized the Fed's interest rate policy, while White House officials downplayed the dispute.

title: Why MAGA thinks Trump is the Epstein whistleblower
content: The myth appears to originate from a 2018 bookâ€”Fire and Fury by journalist Michael Wolffâ€”which recounts a falling out between Trump and Epstein over a Palm Beach real estate deal. In Wolffâ€™s telling, Trump outbid Epstein for a mansion and then refused to sell it to him, souring their relationship.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Don't feel sad for my employees; Iâ€™ve made billionaires..
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: 'Operation Sindoor continues, preparedness has to be very high': CDS Chauhan
content: CDS Anil Chauhan affirmed the continuation of Operation Sindoor, initiated in response to the Pahalgam attack, emphasising the necessity for constant readiness. He highlighted the evolving nature of warfare, envisioning future soldiers as a blend of information, technology, and scholarly expertise. This declaration coincided with a major IAF exercise in Rajasthan, showcasing India's operational capabilities along the border.

title: JD Vance on Al taking jobs: If robots were coming to take our jobs, you would ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance dismisses fears of AI-driven mass unemployment, asserting that current labor market trends don't support such claims. Speaking at the AI Action Summit in Paris, Vance argued that AI will augment human labor, boosting productivity and creating new job opportunities.

title: Ayesha Curry melt hearts with her adorable message for Golden State Warriors star
content: Ayesha Curry, celebrated entrepreneur and wife of Stephen Curry, recently shared heartwarming moments with her family on Instagram. Amidst her busy schedule with her vegan skincare line, Sweet July Skin, she cherishes quality time with her husband, the Golden State Warriors star, and their four children.

title: Bigg Boss 19 comes back with a new season and a new logo; watch video
content: Bigg Boss season 19 is set to premiere on August 30, introducing a fresh, AI-influenced theme and an extended duration. Hosted by Salman Khan, the show unveils a brand-new logo after many years, sparking excitement among fans. The redesigned house will be ready by August 20, with housemates now having a say in evictions.

title: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Entertainment headlines are buzzing with Sunjay Kapur's mother's shocking allegations surrounding his death, demanding a thorough investigation. Rishabh Pant playfully hinted at Yuzvendra Chahal's engagement amidst dating rumors, while Suneel Darshan reminisced about Karisma Kapoor and Abhishek Bachchan's chemistry, suggesting external pressures led to their split.

title: TN Class 12 Supplementary Result 2025 out: Scorecards now live
content: The Tamil Nadu Directorate of Government Examinations has announced the HSE Class 12 Supplementary Results 2025 today, July 25. Students can access their scores at dge.tn.gov.in or tnresults.nic.in. Marksheet downloads, answer script requests, and revaluation options are now open, offering students a critical second chance at academic progression and higher education eligibility.

title: Rajnath Singh to lead discussion on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha
content: Parliament is set to debate Operation Sindoor on Monday. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will lead the discussion in Lok Sabha. Home Minister Amit Shah and Foreign Minister S Jaishankar will participate. BJP MPs Anurag Thakur and Nishikant Dubey are also expected to join the debate. Prime Minister Narendra Modi may intervene in the discussion. The operation avenged the Pahalgam massacre.

title: Cardi B sued for assault: Vegas mic toss turns legal; fans question Stefon Diggs romance
content: Amidst swirling breakup rumors, Cardi B faces legal trouble as she's sued for battery by a fan following an incident at a Las Vegas club in July 2023. The lawsuit alleges Cardi B threw her microphone at the fan after being splashed with a drink, causing emotional distress and physical injury.

title: Coldplay 'Kiss Cam' row: Astronomer CEO, HR head quit amid romance scandal
content: A Coldplay concert's 'kiss cam' sparked a scandal for Astronomer executives. CEO Andy Byron resigned after the viral video revealed an affair with Chief People Officer Kristin Cabot, who also later stepped down. The incident led to public scrutiny and discussions about workplace ethics.

title: Donald Trump signs NIL executive order to stop pay-for-play in college sports
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on July 24, 2025, aiming to regulate name, image, and likeness (NIL) deals in college sports. The order bans third-party "pay-for-play" payments while allowing fair endorsements. It also mandates increased scholarship support for womenâ€™s and non-revenue sports at wealthier athletic departments, addressing concerns about competitive balance.

title: India-UK trade deal sealed, but scotch prices to come down only by next year
content: Despite the India-UK trade deal slashing scotch import duties, consumers shouldn't expect drastic price drops immediately. Ratification by the UK Parliament is pending, and even then, price reductions will likely be limited to 8-10% due to state taxes and distribution costs. While international and Indian spirits makers welcome the move, the real impact on consumers will be modest.

title: IND vs ENG: Root eclipses Dravid, Kallis for most runs in Test cricket - top 10 list
content: Joe Root surpassed cricket legends Jacques Kallis and Rahul Dravid to become the third-highest run-scorer in Test cricket history during the fourth Test against India. Ahead of start, Ricky Ponting praised Root's remarkable career, highlighting his transformation and consistent ability to convert fifties into significant hundreds.

title: Crackdown on 'indecent' content: Govt bans over 20 OTT platforms; check full list
content: In a significant move, the Indian government has banned 25 Over-the-top (OTT) media platforms for allegedly broadcasting obscene content. The decision, made in consultation with various ministries, legal bodies, and industry experts, aims to curb access to pornographic material, particularly for minors.

title: '4 attempts made to kill Tejashwiâ€™: Rabri Devi's explosive claim
content: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi has alleged that her son, Tejashwi Yadav's life is under threat, claiming four prior assassination attempts. Speaking to the media, she accused BJP-JD(U) members of plotting against Tejashwi, the INDIA bloc's potential CM face in Bihar.

title: MNS cracks down on Gujarati signage, issues warning to highway restaurants
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers targeted restaurants and hotels along the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway, demanding the prioritization of Marathi language. They warned establishments to change their signboards and menus to Marathi, damaging some Gujarati signboards in the process. MNS leaders emphasized that there would be no compromise on Marathi in Maharashtra, asserting that businesses must comply to operate in the state.

title: Cricketer Yash Dayal accused of sexually assaulting minor; second case against him
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru bowler Yash Dayal faces a second FIR, this time in Jaipur, accused of repeatedly sexually assaulting a minor in 2023 and again in April 2024. This follows a previous rape complaint filed in Ghaziabad. Police have registered the case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and POCSO Act, initiating investigations and recording the survivor's statement.

title: ULLU, ALTBalaji and 23 streaming sites banned over explicit content
content: The Indian government has banned 25 apps and websites, including ALTBalaji and ULLU, for showcasing obscene, vulgar, and pornographic content. Authorities found these platforms violated policies and laws with sexually explicit acts and nudity in unsuitable contexts.

title: â€˜Did you meet Trump in presence of girls?â€™: Watch old video of Epstein interview
content: A 2010 video shows Jeffrey Epstein refusing to answer questions about Donald Trump and underage girls. He cited his Fifth Amendment rights. The video has resurfaced recently. Epstein and Trump were once close but had a falling out. Epstein faced sex offense charges in 2006 and 2019. He died in jail.

title: Where is Bihar's Rs 70,877 crore public fund? CAG flags â€˜embezzlement riskâ€™
content: The findings were part of the CAGâ€™s report on State Finances for the year 2023â€“24, which was tabled in the state assembly on Thursday.

title: Wasim Akram rings the five-minute bell ahead of Day 3 at Old Trafford
content: Pakistani cricket legend Wasim Akram inaugurated Day 3 of the fourth Test between India and England at Old Trafford by ringing the five-minute bell. He followed in the footsteps of former England cricketer Neil Fairbrother, who performed the honor on Day 2.

title: Death sudden and suspicious: Sunjay Kapurâ€™s mother writes to Sona Comstar board
content: Rani Kapur, mother of the late Sunjay Kapur, has requested Sona Comstar to postpone its AGM, citing her son's death. She alleges being coerced into signing documents without understanding them during her grieving period. Kapur also expresses concerns about recent management changes and lack of transparency, seeking a delay to properly evaluate proposed resolutions and gather information.

title: AI gone wild: ChatGPT caught giving step-by-step guides to murder
content: A disturbing investigation reveals OpenAI's ChatGPT providing explicit instructions for self-mutilation, ritualistic bloodletting, and even murder. The chatbot offered detailed guidance, invocations, and printable PDFs for dangerous practices, raising serious concerns about AI safety guardrails. Similar issues plague Google's Gemini and Elon Musk's Grok, highlighting industry-wide failures in content moderation and user safety.

title: 'Saiyaara': Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda starrer maintains pace; crosses Rs 170
content: Saiyaara continues its box office success, earning â‚¹172.75 crore in its first week, despite a slight dip mid-week. The film is expected to grow over the weekend due to the holiday and lack of major competition, with 'Son Of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' release dates being pushed. On its second Friday, the film has already grossed â‚¹2.

title: Kamal Haasan sworn in as Rajya Sabha MP, takes oath in Tamil
content: Kamal Haasan, the veteran actor and Makkal Needhi Maiam founder, is now a Rajya Sabha MP. He took his oath in Tamil. He expressed honour to serve in the Upper House. Haasan's entry marks a significant step in his political journey. He was nominated with DMK-led alliance support. He had filed his nomination earlier this month

title: Chess WC | India assured of medals; but what to expect from Humpy vs Deshmukh final?
content: India is guaranteed gold and silver at the FIDE Womenâ€™s World Cup as Divya Deshmukh and Koneru Humpy face off in the final. Humpy, the reigning World Rapid Champion, brings decades of experience, while Deshmukh, a rising star, showcases fearless play. The winner secures a spot in the 2026 Candidates Tournament, marking a significant moment for Indian chess.

title: Sundar Pichai joins the â€˜billionaire clubâ€™ after leading Google for over a decade
content: Sundar Pichai, Alphabet's CEO since 2015, has achieved billionaire status with a net worth of $1.1 billion, driven by Alphabet's market value soaring by over $1 trillion since early 2023. His leadership through technological shifts and strategic investments in AI have transformed Alphabet's core businesses, leading to substantial financial success.

title: Bill Clinton also among 50 who wrote birthday note to Epstein
content: Bill Clinton sent a birthday letter to Jeffrey Epstein for his 50th birthday in 2003, joining nearly 50 others, including Donald Trump, who also contributed. The messages were compiled by Ghislaine Maxwell into an album. The Wall Street Journal reported on the contents of the album, detailing the senders and the nature of their messages to Epstein.

title: â€˜Been hit quite hardâ€¦â€™: Bajaj Auto reels from Chinaâ€™s rare earth magnet curbs
content: Bajaj Auto may halt electric scooter production in August due to China's rare earth magnet curbs, impacting Chetak and GoGo models. The company faces a potential 'zero month' due to high volume requirements and limited alternatives.

title: Stock market crash: Nifty50 goes below 24,850, Sensex down over 700 pts - top reasons for fall
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, crashed in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 went below 24,850, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points.

title: 'From one chaiwala to another': PM Modi, UK PM Starmer enjoy cup of tea
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK's Keir Starmer strengthened India-UK ties over 'chai pe charcha' at Chequers after signing the Free Trade Agreement. The leaders displayed a strong rapport during their meeting, with PM Modi emphasizing a robust partnership using cricket analogies. The India-UK Free Trade Agreement was signed by commerce ministers from both nations.

title: Floral splendour marks first Sravana Friday at Durga temple in Vijayawada
content: Special Kumkumarchanas draw devotees in large numbers; temple ensures smooth darshan with tech-enabled crowd management

title: Lok Sabha to take up Justice Varmaâ€™s removal
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar informing Rajya Sabha about Opposition-backed notice cannot be treated as its admission, say sources

title: Teachersâ€™ unions slam KSHEC vice-chairperson Rajan Gurukkalâ€™s remarks on the administrative deadlock at Kerala University
content: Prof. Gurukkal, during a recent interview with The Hindu, had emphasised the role of the Vice-Chancellor as the sole executive and academic head of the university

title: Over 400 bicycles handed over to school students
content: Minister for Energy Gottipati Ravi Kumar says that the school students are being provided with quality meals, bags, and textbooks free of political branding and the State is ensuring a supportive learning environment across all government schools

title: Syro-Malabar Church condemns misinformation by Janam TV
content: Church says the channel uses the false alias of Charlie Thomas for Govindachamy not for factual accuracy, but to inflame communal sentiments

title: NHRC issues notice to Uttar Pradesh government over alleged police torture leading to death
content: Observing that the matter raises a serious issue of violation of human rights of the victim, the commission has issued a notice to the Director General of Police, Uttar Pradesh, calling for a detailed report on the matter, within two weeks.

title: Rajnath Singh, Naidu hail successful trial of UAV-launched missile in Kurnool
content: This proves Indiaâ€™s ability to master complex technologies and produce worldâ€‘class systems indigenously, says Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh

title: Madiga community to stage State-wide protest on Aug. 1 for internal reservation
content: The former Minister Narayanswamy warns that the agitation will intensify if the governmentÂ turns a deaf ear to the long-pending demand

title: Congress stages protest demanding repair of crumbling Medical Collegeâ€“Mundur road
content: The deteriorated condition of the road is not just negligence, it is a direct challenge to the people, says Congress leader

title: Neglect of the elderly, a growing social malady in A.P.
content: As elderly population in Andhra Pradesh is poised to rise over the next decade, instances of neglect and abuse of senior citizens at the hands of their family members are taking the centre stage. Now, it is up to the government to deal with the daunting task of devising effective measures to ensure that the elderly live their final years with the dignity and care they rightfully deserve, writes P. Sujatha Varma

title: Met office predicts heavy rain over Ghats, cooler days for rest of T.N.
content: An offshore trough along Maharashtra-Kerala coasts may trigger very heavy rainfall in isolated parts of the Nilgiris and Coimbatore districts on Saturday. One or two places in Theni and Tenkasi districts have chances of heavy rainfall, says RMC

title: Kerala delegation to undergo intensive training in natural farming in Andhra Pradesh
content: As part of the National Mission on Natural Farming, a 34-member Kerala team comprising scientists, KVK experts, and farmer trainers will visit Andhra Pradesh from July 26 to 29 for hands-on training under the APCNF programme, hosted by IGGAARL across Guntur and Prakasam districts

title: Court seeks Tihar Jailâ€™s response on 26/11 accused Tahawwur Ranaâ€™s plea for phone call to family
content: Rana, extradited from the U.S. in April, also sought bed and mattress; jail authorities cite age restriction under jail manual

title: Education sector in A.P. is in crisis, says Sailajanath
content: Alleging that huge fee reimbursement and hostel dues are pending contrary to the government claims, the YSRCP leader accuses the NDA regime of neglecting students and promoting corporate interests

title: Andhra Pradesh transport staff protest plan to hand over RTC land for mall in Vijayawada
content: Union leaders call the move a threat to public assets; demand that the proposed mall be shifted to Gollapudi instead of prime depot land

title: Enforcement squads in action to check road race on Kozhikode-Kuttiady route
content: Traffic regulatory committee meeting to be held in Perambra on July 26 to address the other major road safety concerns on the route

title: CPI(M) says U.S. protectionism could reduce employment prospects of Kerala youth
content: Govindan term decision of V-Cs of certain State-funded universities to address a â€œknowledge meetâ€ chaired by RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat a disgrace to Kerala

title: Kerala Tourism in high hopes for its Look East campaign after decision to restore Chinese tourist visas
content: Kerala Tourism had kicked off the Look East campaign to woo tourists from eight East Asian countries, including China, in April this year

title: Andhra Pradesh MPs have turned puppets in the hands of Prime Minister Modi, alleges APCC chief Sharmila
content: Accusing them of not fighting for the cause of people of the State, she cites as examples the unfulfilled promises such as Special Category Status, special package for backwards regions, among others

title: India announces â‚¹4,850 crore Line of Credit to Maldives
content: Mr. Modi also announced that the two countries will work towards finalising a bilateral investment treaty and that negotiations for a free trade pact have already started.

title: Five new Volvo Airavat Club Class 2.0 buses flagged off
content: According to KSRTC, these new-generation buses, a continuation of the 20 flagged off by the Chief Minister in December 2024, will operate on the Bengaluru-Tirupati (one bus), Mangaluru-Bengaluru (two buses), and Mysuru-Mantralaya (two buses) routes

title: Madras High Court orders notices to DVAC, Senthilbalaji on AIADMK advocateâ€™s plea to register FIR in alleged transformer procurement scam
content: Justice P. Velmurugan also permits serving of private notice, returnable by four weeks, on the former Electricity Minister

title: Set up multi-disciplinary farm universities, says expert
content: Assistant Director-General of ICAR Seema Jaggi inaugurates eighth postgraduate research conference organised at UAS in Dharwad

title: DPR for semi-ring road project likely to be finalised by end of August
content: The project includes construction of an elevated corridor near the integrated bus terminus for the through-traffic on the highway; NHIA is said to be keen on awarding contract this financial year

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu walks the talk, to adopt â€˜Bangaru Familiesâ€™ as part of P4 initiative to eradicate poverty
content: Saying that the battle against poverty must be collective, the Chief Minister asserts that his familyâ€™s involvement will inspire other well-off individuals to join the movement as â€˜Margadarsisâ€™; Palnadu district records highest number of family adoptions, while Visakhapatnam is at the bottom of the chart

title: Cabbieâ€™s death: Five arrested on charges of murder
content: The accused have been identified as Karthik, Shashank, Sagar, Kushal, and Darshan, all aged between 20 and 24.

title: This Kerala woman weaves her dreams into fashion
content: Aswathyâ€™s bridal dresses are much sought after in countries like Australia, the U.K., the U.S.A, the UAE and Ireland. With materials sourced from northern India, her designer creations like lehengas, gowns and sarees are priced between â‚¹10,000 and â‚¹50,000

title: â€œKaruthalâ€™â€˜ scholarship scheme empowers students from plantation sector in Idukki
content: The initiative, launched by IAS officer Arjun Pandian hailing from Elappara to give back to his roots, recognises   academic performance, excellence in sports and other extracurricular activities. A total of 34 students receive scholarships in this yearâ€™s award ceremony.

title: Covid vaccination had no effect on risk of heart attacks: Health Minister Nadda tells Lok Sabha
content: In a written response to a question in Lok Sabha, he also clarified that data regarding heart attack cases is not maintained centrally

title: Over â‚¹104-cr. tax evasion by tobacco product dealers detected this fiscal year: Govt
content: In a written reply, Minister of State for Health Prataprao Jadhav said the Department of Revenue has informed that illegal trade of tobacco products is a clandestine activity and hence, the loss of revenue cannot be accurately estimated.

title: Vignanâ€™s University to hold 13th convocation on August 2 and 3
content: Governor Syed Abdul Nazeer to attend as chief guest; over 3,200 students to receive degrees, with separate ceremonies for online and polytechnic streams

title: Duty-free access to U.K. under FTAÂ to drive foreign investment into India
content: The CETA, signed by India and the United Kingdom on Thursday (July 24, 2025), includes a separate chapter on â€˜Rules of Originâ€™, which stipulates what kinds of goods are eligible for the reduced tariffs the deal provides.Â

title: To prevent closure of school with one student, villagers seek roads at Erode hamlet
content: With no electricity and roads, nearly two-thirds of families in the remote hamlet inside Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve at Kadambur Hills migrated

title: Won't accept any post after retirement: CJI Gavai
content: CJI Gavai was speaking after being felicitated at Darapur, his native village in Maharashtraâ€™s Amravati district.

title: Daily Quiz | Significant events on July 25
content: Some significant events occurred on July 25. Here is a quiz on observances, birthdays and everything else that happened on the day.

title: Consensual sex between adolescents aged 16 to 18 years must not be treated as abuse: amicus curiae to SC
content: Amicus curiae and senior advocate Indira Jaising submits that the word â€˜childâ€™ in Section 2(d) of POCSO should not include individuals aged between 16 and 18 who engage in consensual sexual activity.

title: India's first hydrogen-powered train coach successfully tested at ICF Chennai: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: According to the Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's social media X post, the country is working on a 1,200 horsepower hydrogen train, which will help India to place itself amongst the leaders in hydrogen-powered train technology

title: DMK governmentâ€™s failure to take stern action has emboldened criminals: Palaniswami
content: The Leader of Opposition launched the AIADMKâ€™s outreach initiative christened â€˜Uruttukalum Thiruttukalumâ€™ to circulate pamphlets containing a set of promises made by the DMK government in the run up to the 2021 Assembly elections

title: Power Rankings entering Week 9: Outlaws, Atlas stay on top
content: the premier lacrosse league will be in Salt Lake City this week for week 9 of the regular season . the top three in the standings remains steady, but there's some movement in the middle of the pack . current record: 5-2 Previous ranking: 1 The Outlaws are the league's hottest team .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal?
content: the 2025 draft has wrapped up, with the rookie class debuting at summer leagues and teams looking ahead to next season . we polled 20 anonymous executives and scouts, asking for their thoughts on the draft and what teams are expecting from their new faces .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Summer storylines for all 32 teams
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on how strong each team will be in the 2025-26 season . this edition includes the top storyline for each team during the summer break, which generates our master list .

title: How Jen Welter's hiring by the Cardinals a decade ago has changed the NFL landscape for women
content: a decade ago, when she was 12, she was her first love . her father, former Div. III player Lawyer Wilson, Jr., taught her the game . she is entering her second season as an assistant coach with the Buffalo Bills .

title: Semifinal talking points: BonmatÃ­'s genius, England's luck, too few teams?
content: defending champions England needed a 96th-minute equalizer and a penalty in extra time to overcome Italy . but both teams struggled through their semifinals to get there . the tournament is down the final two, and it's a repeat of the 2023 world cup final .

title: The GyÃ¶keres-to-Arsenal saga finally looks close to ending. What took so long?
content: arsenal are in a bad spot amid a transfer standoff with Sporting CP for Viktor GyÃ¶keres . the striker's name is still looming over the club's preseason tour to Asia and he isn't even a Gunner yet . he'll shock everyone after an arsenal fan event at an Irish bar .

title: Rodgers opens with pick: Got it out of the way
content: Aaron Rodgers completed his first pass in his first team period at the Pittsburgh Steelers practice . the fourth-time MVP picked off the opening throw from a linebacker . "it's going to be a good challenge for me throwing in this heat every single day," he said.

title: 4,078 days: PM Modi surpasses Indira Gandhi's 48-yr-old record; 2nd-longest consecutive stint
content: From changing his name to loving â€˜Buffy: The Vampire Slayerâ€™; here are lesser-known facts about â€˜Mr Fantasticâ€™ 9 best foods for people with diabetes Affordable SUVs with panoramic sunroof under Rs 15 lakh: XUV 3XO, MG Astor and more Divyanka Tripathiâ€™s top 10 gorgeous looks Speak English with ease: 9 tricks to build your confidence Never forget your exam prep again: 8 essential memory hacks Nidhhi Agerwal's stunning dresses to inspire your wardrobe 10 signs of a high-value woman â€” And how to be one 8 weekend activities to help children build essential life skills Shehnaaz Gillâ€™s Festive Ethnic Looks for Rakhi

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Bills embrace 'Hard Knocks' presence
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . follow the links below to learn everything we are seeing and hearing at camp .

title: The All-Under-Pressure Team: 15 people with something huge on the line in 2025
content: the Ravens, Chiefs and Bills are considered AFC favorites . the season of training camps and contract extension season can lead to a surge of deals in July . over the past two weeks alone, T.J. Watt , Sauce Gardner , Garrett Wilson and Trey Smith have all signed extensions .

title: Expert picks, best bets: How can Whittaker bounce back vs. de Ridder at UFC Fight Night?
content: Reinier de Ridder claims a second-round TKO to give bo Nickal his first career UFC loss . the pair will host their first of two 2025 fight cards in Abu Dhabi this weekend . he suffered a first-round submission loss against Khamzat Chimaev in his last Octagon appearance .
